intro: Pluchea cortesii, commonly known as Mexican ragweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellowish-green. It is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
